title: Are you one of God's 144,000? - Quora

response.answer_text: I know that the Watchtower and Tract Society is wrong because it doesn’t teach the same as the majority of true Christianity. But I also base my answer on who the WTS says Jesus is and that the WTS teaches that Jesus wasn’t resurrected with a body, the way true Christianity says. When I read the Chapter in Revelation I see that 12,000 from each tribe is sealed. Now, as I understand the book of Revelation, it’s filled with symbolic language. How can someone put symbolic language to the words but when it comes to the numbers they consider them literal? When I see the words, I see that the tribes of Israel are being sealed. These are the people whom God sent His Son to. But, I am part of the Gentile group. Jesus at the end of His earthly ministry told His disciples to make disciples of all the world, to us Gentiles. As a Gentile, I can become a Christian, get saved in the name of Jesus and make Him my Lord, as I already have. I can go to heaven. Now, the 144,000 is 12,000 X 12 and there were 12 tribes. Since I am not Jewish, I am not part of the 144,000. But I am still saved. How do I know this? If we were to take both numbers and words literally, the following verse of the Chapter that speaks about the 144,000 says, “After this I looked, and there before me was a great multitude that no one could count, from every nation, tribe, people and language, standing before the throne and before the Lamb. They were wearing white robes and were holding palm branches in their hands.” I bolded two words that signify time after the 144,000 were sealed John looked and there was a great multitude, that none can number. We know this cannot be the 144,000 because the verse says, “ a great multitude that no one could count,” and the previous verses literally just counted 144,000 from each tribe. So, the “great multitude that no one could count” must be greater than 144,000 but so much that no one can count. I know that scripture is talking about me, I’m in that great multitude somewhere standing before the throne and before the Lamb. I will be wearing a white robe and holding two palm branches one in each hand. Revelation 7:9 (NIV) After this I looked, and there before me was a great multitude that no one could count, from every nation, tribe, people and language, standing before the throne and before the Lamb. They were wearing white robes and were holding palm branches in their hands.

Let's, first of all, set something straight. Who are the 144,000?Although Revelation 7:4 tells us that the 144,000 are the only ones sealed, we should note that they are not the only ones who will attain salvation. Instead, as Revelation 14:4 describes, they are ‘the firstfruits of the redeemed.’ Now, this of course means that a much larger number of people will be redeemed after them.—Revelation 7:9, 10. The 144,000 are those who come “from the earth” so as to stand with Christ on heavenly mount Zion, from where they will rule as kings over the earth.—Revelation 14:1, 3; see Hebrews 12:22, 28. And just as the kings of ancient Israel were called Jehovah's anointed, so also those who have been called to become part of the 144,000 are Jehovah's anointed.—2 Kings 9:3; 2 Corinthians 1:21. One becomes a part of the 144,000 only after he has been irrevocably sealed in his forehead, identified as a conqueror—trained, tested, and trusted to shoulder the weighty responsibilities to which he was called. (1 Peter 5:10; see 2 Timothy 4:7, 8) Where do they come from?The 144,000 are described, at Revelation 14:1, as having Jesus’ name and Jehovah's written on their foreheads, showing that they all “stem from one.”—Hebrews 2:11. Ephesians 4:4, 5 agrees that the entire members of the body of those called to this hope stem from “one faith.” So they are not found among Christendom's many denominations, for each denomination has been shown to have it’s own faith, or doctrines, an overlooking of 1 Corinthians 1:10. Now, these ones who have Jehovah's name boldly inscribed on their foreheads evidently stem from those who proudly identify themselves as “a people for His name,” as “witnesses of God.”—Acts 15:14; 1 Corinthians 15:15. Jehovah has been calling his faithful Witnesses to be part of the 144,000 ever since the new covenant went into effect at Pentecost 33 C.E. Jesus’ faithful apostles were the first ones called, along with over 100 others when they were anointed with holy spirit.—Acts 1:5, 15. However, the scriptures show that only a “remnant” of these called ones will be on the earth at this time of the end, showing that although the calling hasn't ended, yet there is a limited need to administrators in God's heavenly Kingdom. (Revelation 12:17; KJV) And for this reason, the time of the end is the season for God to gather, through the good news, those who will live forever on the earth under the rulership of Jesus and the 144,000.—Revelation 7:9, 14; 21:4, 5.  Now, to answer your question, because it's hard to talk about being part of a select few without coming across as vain and/or arousing unseemly feelings in others, even Jehovah's anointed ones in ancient times, including Jesus, took care not to openly disclose this information.—1 Samuel 10:1, 16; 2 Kings 9:6, 11; Matthew 16:20; John 10:24. For this reason, it isn't very likely that the Lord's anointed will openly identify themselves on a public forum such as this. However, know this one thing: The remaining ones of those called to be part of this specially blessed group are living and dwelling among us today, and once “the number [is] filled,” the great tribulation will break forth.—Revelation 6:10, 11.

No, Justin, I am not one of the 144,000 chosen to be in heaven with Christ who will co-rule over the earth for a thousand years. (Revelation 5:9,10; 14:1,3; 20:6). I am one of the great crowd who John also saw but whom he said “no man was able to number.” (Revelation 7:9,10) I am happy to belong to the great crowd who will inherit the earth. Somehow, on some level, when I was young I knew that I really did not want to leave the earth. Like everyone in my church I chose heaven over hell. But when I came to an understanding that there was no hell, a place of fiery torment where God torture people after they die, I wanted to live on earth forever. I became very aware of my love for life on earth a few years before I learned about the earthly paradise. I was a very young teacher then. I was teaching poetry. The poem- “An old woman thinks about the hereafter.” In this poem, Hendricks, the poet, described the beauty and serenity this old woman loved about earth. I fell in love with that poem and taught it many times not knowing that I would in the future be learning that the old woman’s wishes in the poem would become the reality of billions in paradise earth. So I understand why so many people wish to go to heaven. But when they come into an understanding of what paradise earth entails they are happy to hope for such a wonderful place to spend eternity. The bottom lines are: Man was created for the earth and not for heavenThe 144k go to heaven for a specific purposeFor man to go to heaven he has to be chosen by God and Jesus ChristHeaven is not a destination any human can make a choice to go, uninvitedThose who are called to heaven are changed from physical, mortal persons to spiritual, immortal beingsThey leave everything and everyone on earth willingly and are happy to become corulers with ChristIn this life they are not materialistic but focus on spiritual richesSo, Justin, I am looking forward to everlasting life on a peaceful earth. The ones who go to heaven are not superior to the ones on earth. Just as a president or prime minister is not superior to others in his country. It is a position that has to be filled. So the 144k are not superior Christians. Jesus started to choose them on the Day of Pentecost, has chosen them through the centuries and based on Bible chronology, most of them are already in heaven. Comparatively few are still on earth today. We may be nearer to realizing the paradise than we are aware.

Greetings, peace to you, and thank you for the A2A - I hesitated to answer; it's a very personal and subjective thing, is it not? But given most of the other responses, I have been directed to answer this… for the sake of truth. Yes. I am one from among the 12,000 sealed of tribe of Ben'JaH'Min. What does that mean? Everything… and nothing. It means “everything” in that I have received a sealing from the One who repurchased me with his blood, as one from among 144,000 of the sons of Israel (and not non-Israelite Gentiles), which include Jews (those of the 2-tribe kingdom of “Judah,” consisting of the descendants Jacob/Israel's sons, JaH’u’dah and Ben'JaH'Min) and Samaritans (those of the 10-tribe kingdom of “Israel," consisting of the descendants of 9 of Jacob/Israel’s other 10 sons - Dan is excluded and his portion given to JaH'Sef's son, Manasseh, so that, as Rachel's firstborn son, JaH'Sef has a double portion). This is “everything” because it means the fulfillment of the promise to Abraham as to his seed. Initially, by means of Ad'Ham, ALL of mankind would have been sons of God, the “Father” (Begetter), who is the MOST Holy, because Ad'Ham himself was God's son (issue/get) - Luke 3:38. When Ad'Ham turned over his inheritance, however, he included his entire lineage (Genesis 1:28; Luke 4:6, 7; John 14:30; 1 John 5:19) and so mankind was given to and became the progeny of another “father"… or begetter (John 8:44)… which “father" had led them all to death.The MOST Holy planned to turn things around by allowing his other son, the “Son" (Issue/Get) who is (now) the Holy (Spirit - 2 Corinthians 3:17, 18) “beget" children for Him, this time eternally (Isaiah 9:6). The entire group that was to become sons to replace the sons lost to the MOST Holy by Ad'Ham initially, were to be ALL of Abraham's descendants… through his son, Isaac, and Isaac's son, Jacob (aka Israel). To their great blessing, they were supposed to be a people for a special possession, a royal nation and holy priesthood. Not because they were special (indeed, they repeatedly showed how much they were not), but because Abraham was special. Abraham did not withhold his willingness to sacrifice his own son, Isaac (who came to him not by means of the flesh as his son Ishmael did, but by means of a promise to Abraham's barren wife, Sarah). In this, he proved he was the MOST Holy's true friend and Abraham was given the promise that by means of his seed, people of ALL the nations (and not just Israel) would be personally blessed. Isaac's (thwarted) sacrifice, however, was a precursor - because the new lineage would not be of an entirely new creation of humans (i.e., another Ad'Ham/Eve), but a renewing of Ad'Ham's seed. In order to effectuate this renewed lineage, however, something had to die. Because the (re)new(ed) lineage would be taken from among humans who had Ad'Ham's now tainted blood… which blood had sin… and so aging, sickness… death… in it. That blood had to be “cleansed.” In addition, the “sins" (errors) of the spirits (“hearts") of these (which errors have nothing to do with the flesh but with one's own motivations and desires)… had to be “forgiven.” BUT… a “universal law" of the spirit realm is that only blood can cover sins [of the spirit]. And so, unless blood is shed/poured out, no forgiveness of sins takes place (Hebrews 9:22). So, there had to be a sacrifice - no other way to get blood completely shed/poured out. And yes, it had to be shed/poured out completely, which is the critera to “cover.” Why? Because life… is in the blood (Leviticus 17:11). It is also in the breath (Genesis 2:7; Ezekiel 37:1-10)… and the seed (Matthew 1:20). No blood, no breath, no seed… no life. This blood, however, had to be able to cleanse and cover ALL sins for ALL… so it couldn't be mere animal blood. Hence, the coming sacrifice of the Son himself, to forgive and redeem from death, with his own blood (John 6:53-57), the sons that Ad'Ham had sold - mankind, in general. And starting with 144,000 of Abraham's seed through Jacob/Israel, that forgiveness and cleansing is granted. This group is “special” for only 3 reasons: They are the fulfillment of the promise to Abraham as to his seed;They are “virgins” (but not as to the flesh - they are not all men - please don't believe that lie (Matthew 24:24); They are those, men and women who, from the time they are called to be part of the “Bride,” keep themselves clean from the “women” who constitute the “daughters" of the Harlot, Babylon the Great… which is made up of those religions that call themselves “christian" (the others never claim to be joined to Christ - Matthew 23:8-12; 1 Corinthians 7:23; 1 John 2:26, 27). These are those of Abraham's seed through Jacob/Israel who, staying true to the “Bridegroom,” Christ, the Son… and not committing adultery against him by fornicating with others… are “virgins” when he returns to gather them (Matthew 24:31; 5:1-13; Revelation 14:4, 8; 17:1-6);They are the only one among Gods sons who learn and master the “new song.” That song is a song of praise to the MOST Holy which only they are permitted to sing and they do so in the “pure" language of truth. They learn it during their lives, being taught directly by their King, Lamb (Psalm 110:2; Jeremiah 31:31-34), who is the Truth, and whose mouth speaks only truth (John 14:6; Proverbs 8:4-11, 22, 23; John 1:1, 14; Hebrews 4:12; Revelation 19:13-16).It truly is “nothing,” though, because those of this group of 144,000 “from among the sons of Israel,” are not the only ones called to be sons. Because the initially chosen nation, Israel/Judah, as a body, eventually rejected the “father" sent to lead them, as a body, back to the MOST Holy, they were rejected as a body. But not entirely as a nation. Their calling was suspended and replaced by a calling to people of every nation, tribe, and tongue (Romans 11:25). This latter group, consisting of an innumerable company from ALL peoples, join with those 144,000 of from among Abraham's seed to make up the “NEW Jerusalem.” They ALL serve with Christ, The King and High Priest, as lesser kings and priests who provide “sacred" (hence, priestly) service in and as the temple of the MOST Holy. They are ALL bought by Christ… with his blood for this very purpose : to rule and serve as priests with him in his kingdom, which rulership and priesthood he has chosen to share (Revelation 5:9, 10; 7:9-15; 1 Corinthians 3:16; 6:19; Ephesians 2:19-21; 1 Peter 2:5; Revelation 21:22). Once these, the 144,000 and the innumerable company, begin their rulership and priesthood, then ALL of Israel, Abraham's seed through Jacob/Israel, will be saved (Romans 11:26-32)… along with many, many others who are of none of these groups due their kindness and compassion toward others. They are “separated” from the hard-hearted and uncompassionate (Matthew 25:31-46; Luke 10:30-37; Revelation 20:4). It is “nothing,” though, as to both groups because that kingship and priesthood is not one where the kings and priests are raised up… but where they are brought down. Like their God, the MOST Holy, and His Son, their Leader, their's is an administration of service to the people. Of caring for, ensuring the best for, handling matters in love, etc. All that a true son of the MOST not only can do… but will do. It is “nothing,” because they are from among the “least" of mankind. They take and sit in the “lowly,” seat among their brothers. They serve one another and mankind, not look to be served. They raise others up, not themselves. They look on others with compassion not jealousy or judgment. They give to the hungry, heal the sick, take care of the poor, etc. They speak truth with one another and as to, Christ, the Holy, and God, the MOST Holy (Exodus 26:33; Hebrews 9:3; 10:20; Revelation 21:22). As many others do. But there is a very important difference: They ONLY listen to and obey the voice of the LAMB and follows him wherever HE “goes,” and soThey do not seek or do their OWN will but only that of the Father and Son.They literally “disown" themselves… for the love of One who chose to give his blood to redeem them from Ad'Ham's choice for them… and those he loves: mankind (Proverbs 8:30, 31; John 3:16). I hope that helps. Again, peace to you!

Are you one of God's 144,000? Gross. It would take me claiming God’s judgment to say that. I know God’s judgment of me: that I am worth saving. God has judged all so. Christ came to save all. I accept Christ’s sacrifice is on my behalf. I am saved. I am not under any other judgment. The finished work of God’s judgment upon me is already pronounced. It is pronounced “Jesus Christ.” Christ’s merciful judgment has saved me. We must reject ourselves as the judge of humanity, in order to embrace Christ as judge. We are not fit to judge even ourselves. To judge a human being (even ourselves!) is to reject Christ as judge, and substitute ourselves. You cannot reject Christ as judge without rejecting Christ as savior - the two are one. No one is beyond Christ’s saving power. But as we ourselves see fit to judge, we reject Christ and put ourselves under judgment. As we judge, so shall we be judged. And anyone who thinks their judgment is a fit substitute for Christ’s judges horribly. As we judge, so shall we be judged. See fit, if you wish, to count and number yourself. See fit to judge the almost eight billion now living, observing with satisfaction how few can fit your limited conception of who shall be saved. See fit to judge all who have lived before, and account for where they stand in some number you misconstrue as the limit of Christ’s mercy. Your accounting is foul and blasphemous. You are no judge of humanity. You are not fit to judge even in your own case. Thankfully, you have a better judge. I’ll take whatever number God says is mine. I trust the judge, you see: for the judge is also my savior.  To the unversed reader: “The 144,000” is a figure that appears in Revelations, and is misconstrued by unbiblical, unliteral dipsticks as the full count of people who shall be saved. They do this to make themselves feel Elect, special - as they tend to number themselves in the 144,000. They should go back and read the whole passage, where the entire 144,000 are referred to explicitly as Israelites, made up of the 12 tribes of Israel. Also saved, according to the same passage of Revelations, are “a great multitude, which no man can number,” out of all nations of the Earth. Actually now that I think of it, I’m not of any tribe of Israel. So I’d probably end up in the second group. But really, I’ll take whatever number God gives me - and remain mindful of the fact that no man can number the saved. No, nor woman neither, I reckon.

The idea that there are only 144,000 of God people is inaccurate therefore crippling the Jehovah's Witness movement. The idea comes from the book of Revelation where it says that in the end times 144,000 people were sealed as God's chosen people. What the JW fail to realize is that this is a post rapture event, so AFTER God has come back for the current church THAN there will be at LEAST 144,000. This doesn't mean that throughout all time there will only ever be 144,000 believers. The idea that there are only 144,000 is preposterous as about 8,000,000 people world wide believe this and every one thinks that they are a part of the 144,000, that means that 7,856,000 people aren't true JW and it would be impossible to know who are part of the real JW movement and are truly God's people. That whole doctrine is a prime example of what happens when people don't understand the scriptures and take it out of context. To answer the question of who I think I am; I am a sinner who has been forgiven and washed by the blood of Christ my savior. Now I am a messenger of the living God and a vessel of his Holy Spirit and by his goodness I am a tool set apart for his divine work and my mission is to help spread the hope and peace I have found in God most high. I hope this clears up some of the misconceptions about the scriptures and I apologize if I came off a bit pointed. I tend to get quite passionate about subjects like this. God bless.

(Revelation 14:1) Then I saw, and look! the Lamb standing on Mount Zion, and with him 144,000 who have his name and the name of his Father written on their foreheads.” Here we see the limited number of these anointed ones—144,000. Their royal status is discerned in that they stand with Jehovah’s enthroned King, “the Lamb,” Jesus. And they are on heavenly Mount Zion. Earthly Mount Zion was the location of Jerusalem, Israel’s royal city. Heavenly Mount Zion represents the exalted position of Jesus and his joint heirs, who make up heavenly Jerusalem.—2 Chronicles 5:2; Psalm 2:6. Jesus and his associates rule from a superior position. In his dream-vision, Daniel also saw that “the kingdom and the rulership . . . were given to the people who are the holy ones.” (Daniel 7:27) Jesus does not rule alone. He has others with him who are to rule as kings and serve as priests. (Revelation 5:9, 10; 20:6) Concerning them, the apostle John wrote: “I saw, and, look! the Lamb standing upon the Mount Zion, and with him a hundred and forty-four thousand . . . who have been bought from the earth.”—Revelation 14:1-3. The Lamb is Jesus Christ in his Kingdom position. (John 1:29; Revelation 22:3) This Mount Zion refers to heaven. (Hebrews 12:22) Jesus and his 144,000 associates are ruling from heaven. What a lofty position from which to rule! Being in heaven, they have a broader perspective. Since heaven is its seat, “the kingdom of God” is also called “the kingdom of the heavens.” (Luke 8:10; Matthew 13:11) No weapons, not even nuclear attacks, can reach and topple that heavenly government. It is unconquerable and will fulfill Jehovah’s purpose for it.—Hebrews 12:28. God’s Kingdom has trustworthy representatives on earth. How do we know this? Psalm 45:16 states: “You will appoint . . . princes in all the earth.” “You” in this prophecy is the Son of God. (Psalm 45:6, 7; Hebrews 1:7, 8) Hence, Jesus Christ himself will appoint the princely representatives. We can be sure that they will be faithful in carrying out his direction. Even today, qualified men who serve as elders in the Christian congregation are taught, not to “lord it over” their fellow believers, but to protect, refresh, and comfort them.—Matthew 20:25-28; Isaiah 32:2. The Kingdom has righteous subjects. They are blameless and upright in God’s eyes. (Proverbs 2:21, 22) “The meek ones themselves will possess the earth,” says the Bible, “and they will indeed find their exquisite delight in the abundance of peace.” (Psalm 37:11) The subjects of the Kingdom are meek—teachable and humble, mild and gentle. Their primary interests are spiritual matters. (Matthew 5:3) They want to do what is right and are responsive to divine direction. God’s Kingdom is governed by superior laws. The laws and principles governing the Kingdom come from Jehovah God himself. Rather than unfairly restrict us, they benefit us. (Psalm 19:7-11) Many people are already benefiting from living by Jehovah’s righteous requirements. For example, heeding the Bible’s counsel to husbands, wives, and children improves our family life. (Ephesians 5:33–6:3) When we obey the command to ‘clothe ourselves with love,’ our relationship with others improves. (Colossians 3:13, 14) As we live by Scriptural principles, we also cultivate good work habits and a balanced view of money. (Proverbs 13:4; 1 Timothy 6:9, 10) Avoiding drunkenness, sexual immorality, tobacco, and addictive drugs helps us to safeguard our health.—Proverbs 7:21-23; 23:29, 30; 2 Corinthians 7:1. The Kingdom of God is a government ordained by God. Its King—the Messiah, Jesus Christ—and all his associate rulers are responsible to God to uphold His just laws and loving principles. The subjects of the Kingdom, including its earthly representatives, take delight in living by God’s laws. God is thus at the center of the lives of the rulers and the subjects of the Kingdom. Therefore, the Kingdom is a true theocracy—rule by God. It is bound to succeed in accomplishing the purpose for which it has been set up. But when does God’s Kingdom, also known as the Messianic Kingdom, begin its rule In harmony with this, the anointed in their heavenly glory are also spoken of as “New Jerusalem.” (Revelation 21:2) Earthly Jerusalem was “the city of the great King” and also the location of the temple. (Matthew 5:35) The heavenly New Jerusalem is the royal Kingdom organization through which the great Sovereign, Jehovah, and his appointed King, Jesus, now rule and in which priestly service is performed as rich blessings flow from Jehovah’s throne for the healing of mankind.
